verses.text: The beginning of the word of the instruction of Peter the Apostle, which he taught to his disciple Clement regarding the mysteries of the kingdom of heaven.
And Peter said: 'Listen, my son Clement, to the words which the Lord spoke to me when we were on the Mount of Olives, after He had risen from the dead.'
'He told me of the things that were in the beginning, and of the things that shall be in the last days, and of the order of the priesthood which He hath established in His Church.'
'Therefore, write down these words in a book, and keep them for those who shall come after thee, that they may know the path of life and not go astray.'
And Clement said: 'My lord and teacher, I will do all that thou hast commanded me, for thy words are as a lamp to my feet and a light to my path.'
Then Peter began to teach him, saying: 'Know first, my son, that God is one, and there is no other god beside Him; He is the Creator of all that is seen and all that is unseen.'
'He created the angels and the powers of heaven by His word, and He established the earth upon the waters by His wisdom.'
'And He made man in His own image and likeness, that he might rule over the earth and glorify his Creator.'
And Peter spoke again to Clement: 'Observe, my son, the order of the seasons and the luminaries of heaven, how they obey the command of God without fail.'
'Even so should the children of men obey the commandments of the Lord, that they may find rest for their souls.'
'But the enemy of righteousness, who is Beliar, seeks to lead men into the darkness of error and to make them forget the law of their God.'
'He puts pride in the hearts of the rich, and despair in the hearts of the poor, and he stirs up strife among brothers.'
'But thou, my son, be strong in the faith and do not fear the snares of the enemy; for the Lord is a shield to those who trust in Him.'
'Keep thy heart pure and thy tongue from evil, and the Holy Spirit will dwell in thee and guide thee into all truth.'
Now regarding the assembly of the faithful, Peter said: 'When you gather together to pray, let there be order and peace in your midst.'
'Let the bishops be as fathers to the people, and let the deacons be as servants of the Lord, ministering to the needs of the saints.'
'Do not allow any man to exalt himself above his neighbor, for we are all members of one body, and Christ is our Head.'
'Remember the words of the Lord, who said: "The greatest among you shall be the servant of all."'
'Provide for the widows and the orphans, and do not turn thy face away from the poor man when he cries for help.'
'For in doing these things, you offer a sweet sacrifice to God, and your names shall be written in the book of life.'
And Peter said: 'Listen, Clement, my son, regarding the soul which God hath breathed into man: it is a light from the Great Light, and it is immortal.'
'When the body returns to the earth from whence it was taken, the soul returns to the place which the Lord hath prepared for it, according to its works.'
'Therefore, keep thy soul from the pollutions of the flesh, that it may be found worthy to behold the face of the Father in the day of resurrection.'
'For the body is but a tabernacle for a season, but the soul is the true man which shall live for ever.'
Peter spake again: 'In the assembly of the saints, let no man speak with a loud voice or with pride, but let every man be humble in the presence of his God.'
'Let the elders be honored for their wisdom, and let the young men be taught to serve with gladness.'
'And if a man hath a grievance against his brother, let him not go to the rulers of this world, but let him seek the counsel of the church, that peace may be restored.'
'For the Lord loveth those who seek peace, and He will call them His children.'
Regarding the mystery of the creation, Peter said: 'In the beginning, God made the heavens and the earth by His Word, which is His Son.'
'And He established the luminaries to mark the times and the seasons, and He gave the law to the winds and the waters that they should not overpass their bounds.'
'Everything which exists is held together by His power, and without Him, nothing would remain in its place.'
'Therefore, when thou lookest upon the works of creation, glorify the Creator who hath made all things for the sake of man.'
And Peter said: 'Clement, my son, take heed to the words of the prophets who went before us, for they spake by the Holy Spirit of the coming of the Savior.'
'They saw His glory from afar and rejoiced, and they endured all manner of afflictions for the sake of His name.'
'Now that He hath come and dwelt among us, we are witnesses of His power and His love.'
'Be thou also a witness, and do not be ashamed of the cross, for it is the power of God unto salvation.'
Now concerning the poor and the needy, Peter commanded: 'Let the church gather tithes and offerings from those who have much, that they may give to those who have nothing.'
'Let no man be hungry in your midst while another hath abundance, for we are all one family in Christ.'
'The wealth of this world passeth away, but the treasure which is given in charity remaineth for ever in heaven.'
'He who giveth to the poor lendeth to the Lord, and the Lord will repay him a hundredfold.'
Peter spake regarding the last days: 'In the end of time, many false prophets shall arise and lead many astray with lying signs and wonders.'
'They shall speak of peace when there is no peace, and they shall turn the hearts of men away from the true faith.'
'But those who remain steadfast until the end shall be saved, and they shall inherit the kingdom which was prepared for them from the foundation of the world.'
'Be watchful, therefore, and pray that ye may be found worthy to stand before the Son of Man when He cometh in His glory.'
Finally, Peter said to Clement: 'Keep these instructions in thy heart, and teach them to the faithful in every place.'
'Let the bishops and the priests be examples of holiness, and let the people follow them in the paths of righteousness.'
'And may the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you all, now and for evermore. Amen.'
